translation: złowrogi [formal; threatening to do something bad or to hurt someone]
sentence: He gave me a baleful look.

translation: odstraszać [to prevent someone from doing something or to make someone less enthusiastic about doing something by making it difficult for that person to do it or by threatening bad results if they do it]
sentence: These measures are designed to deter an enemy attack.

translation: wyprzeć się, wyrzekać się [to say that you know nothing about something, or that you have no responsibility for or connection with something]
sentence: She tried to disavow her past.

translation: diabeł, potwór [an evil and cruel person]
sentence: He was portrayed in the media as a complete fiend.

translation: przodek [a relative who lived in the past; literary]
sentence: How the world has changed: occasionally we rediscover long-forgotten truths that our forebears knew well.

translation: zamazany [not clear in shape or sound]
sentence: Is the picture always fuzzy on your TV?

translation: płaszczyk, postać [what something seems to be, although it is not; formal]
sentence: The men who arrived in the guise of drug dealers were actually undercover police officers.

translation: ponieść (np. konsekwencje) [formal; to experience something, usually something unpleasant, as a result of actions you have taken]
sentence: She had incurred the wrath of her father by marrying without his consent

translation: wyremontować [to repair an engine, machine, etc. so that every part of it works as it should; to completely change a system so that it works more effectively]
widowisko [a competition for young women in which they are judged on their beauty and other qualities]
sentence: Between games, the traditional pageantry includes the parade of champions.

translation: świętoszek [a person who is easily shocked by rude things, especially those of a sexual type]
odchody [faeces (= solid body waste) left by animals]
sentence: The bear scat was analysed and found to come from a grizzly.

translation: szybować [to move quickly and smoothly in the sky, or to move quickly up into the sky]
sentence: The birds were soaring high above.
By tacit agreement, the subject was never mentioned again.
The thorny issue of illegal immigration remains unresolved.
